title: Monster Game
description:
You have been gifted a new game called "Elatyh". In the game, you are given ğ‘› swords, each with its own strength. In particular, the sword numbered ğ‘– has a strength of ğ‘ğ‘–. The game consists of ğ‘› levels, each of which features a monster.

You start at level 1 and progress further. To pass level ğ‘– and move on to level ğ‘–+1, you need to defeat the monster at level ğ‘–. To defeat the monster at level ğ‘–, you need to deal it ğ‘ğ‘– sword strikes. The swords in the game are very fragile, so they can only deal one strike before breaking. If you complete level ğ‘› or run out of swords, you can finish the game and proceed to score calculation.

Before the game, you are allowed to choose the difficulty level. If you choose difficulty ğ‘¥, swords with a strength less than ğ‘¥ will not affect the monsters. The game score in this case is equal to ğ‘¥ multiplied by the number of levels completed. Your task is to choose the game difficulty in such a way as to maximize the game score.

constraints: Consider the first test case. Optimal difficulty to choose is 3. If difficulty is 3, you can deal strikes with swords number 2 and 3. With 2 swords you can complete 1 level, so the game score is 3â‹…1=3.
